metadata.title: CVE-2018-20961 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 4.16.4, a double free vulnerability in thef_midi_set_alt function of drivers/usb/gadget/function/f_midi.c in thef_midi driver may allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possiblyhave unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20961` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-165-generic - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-lowlatency - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-4.4.0-165-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-165-generic - 4.4.0-165.193
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-165-lowlatency - 4.4.0-165.193
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1014-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1123-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1123.132
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1127-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1127.135
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-165.193').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.132').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1127.135').
